title: Zubov's method
summary: Zubov's method is a technique for computing the basin of attraction for a set of ordinary differential equations (a dynamical system). The domain of attraction is the set { x : v ( x ) < 1 } {\displaystyle \{x:\,v(x)<1\}} , where v ( x ) {\displaystyle v(x)} is the solution to a partial differential equation known as the Zubov equation.[1] Zubov's method can be used in a number of ways.
